title: House numbers fonts
content:
Is a numbering found in old houses from early 1900's. Also there is a plate with letters that looks like Bodoni but the numbers are definitely different. Sorry for image quality, are taken from Street View XD

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155126im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sin%20t%C3%ADtulo-1_6316.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155126im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sin%20t%C3%ADtulo-4_6592.jpg)
author: blacklolcat

comments.content:
Didone design from early to mid 19th century? But which one?  
Don

We recently digitized a somewhat similar (but Bolder) set of numbers from a 1838 Specimen Book issued by the Fonderie Clement. Have a look: [http://www.impallari.com/clement](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155126/http:/www.impallari.com/clement "http://www.impallari.com/clement")

Interesting... This one is very similar to another house number very common in Barcelona, but the "2" is not the same

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155126im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sin%20t%C3%ADtulo-2_6065.jpg)

Second set of numbers has some similarity to Firmin Didot by URW:  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?61P](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155126/http:/www.identifont.com/show?61P "http://www.identifont.com/show?61P")  
Also of interest;  
Didot's late style as interpreted by Porchez:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typofonderie/ambroise-std/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155126/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typofonderie/ambroise-std/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typofonderie/ambroise-std/")  
Michel Bold:  
 [http://www.identifont.com/show?1WH3](http://web.archive.org/web/20150419155126/http:/www.identifont.com/show?1WH3 "http://www.identifont.com/show?1WH3")  
Don
